name: SportRxiv
description: SportRxiv is the World's First Open Access Subject Repository for Sport, Exercise and Health Research. I founded the preprint repository in 2016 after reaching out to Prof Brian Nosek at the Centre for Open Science for his advice. Nearly ten years and hundreds of preprints later, the repository is still going strong.

name: Soceity for Transparency, Openness and Replication in Kinesiology
description: The Society for Transpareny, Oppenness and Replication in Kinesiology grew around SportRxiv. As more authors submitted their work to the platform, I identified an opportunity to create a society that would connect scholars but also become the stewards of SportRxiv.

name: Play Aid
description: In response to the Covid-19 pandemic, I founded Play Aid as a way of connecting with young people to explore ways to improve their health and wellbeing. The global men's health charity Movember, funded our Gamers vs Depression project in 2021 and we have worked together since.

name: Erasmus University Rotterdam
description: Since 2023, I have held the role of Open Science Advisor at the University and helped to steer the institutions open science strategies and practices.
